Closure Compiler Maven Plugin
Last Published: 2011-11-08  | Version: 1.6
Closure Compiler Maven Plugin
Parent Project
  • JavaScript Framework
Project Documentation
  • Project Information
  • Project Reports

closure-compiler:js-closure-compile

Full name:

com.github.jlgrock.javascript-framework:closure-compiler-maven-plugin:1.6:js-closure-compile

Description:

(no description)

Attributes:

  • Requires a Maven 2.0 project to be executed.
  • Binds by default to the lifecycle phase: compile.

Required Parameters

Name Type Since Description
closureLibraryLocation File - The location of the closure library. By default, this is expected in the ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework${file. separator}closure-library${file.separator}closure${file.separator}goog directory, as this is where the jsdependency plugin will put it by default. If you would like to override this and use your own location, this can be done by changing this path.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework${file.separator}closure-library.
compileLevel String - Specifies the compiler level to use. Possible values are:
  • WHITESPACE_ONLY
  • SIMPLE_OPTIMIZATIONS
  • ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS

Please see the Google Compiler levels page for more details.
Default value is: ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS.
compiledFilename String - The file produced after running the dependencies and files through the compiler.
Default value is: ${project.build.finalName}-min.js.
frameworkTargetDirectory File - The file produced after running the dependencies and files through the compiler.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework.
generatedDepsJS String - The file produced after running the dependencies and files through the compiler.
Default value is: ${project.build.finalName}-debug.js.
sourceDirectory File - The default directory to extract files to. This likely shouldn't be changed unless there is a conflict with another plugin.
Default value is: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework${file.separator}output${file.separator}processedJavascript.

Optional Parameters

Name Type Since Description
errorLevel String - Specifies how strict the compiler is at following the rules. The compiler is set to parameters matching SIMPLE by default, however, if you don't use WARNING or better, this isn't very useful. STRICT is set by default for this mojo. Possible values are:
  • SIMPLE
  • WARNING
  • STRICT


Default value is: STRICT.
generateExports boolean - (no description)
Default value is: true.
inclusionStrategy String - What to include based off of maven includes. If you are creating an API with an empty src folder, or you expect to use all of the maven dependencies as source, set this to ALL. Possible values are:
  • ALL
  • WHEN_IN_SRCS


Default value is: WHEN_IN_SRCS.

Parameter Details

closureLibraryLocation:

The location of the closure library. By default, this is expected in the ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework${file. separator}closure-library${file.separator}closure${file.separator}goog directory, as this is where the jsdependency plugin will put it by default. If you would like to override this and use your own location, this can be done by changing this path.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework${file.separator}closure-library

compileLevel:

Specifies the compiler level to use. Possible values are:
  • WHITESPACE_ONLY
  • SIMPLE_OPTIMIZATIONS
  • ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS

Please see the Google Compiler levels page for more details.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ADVANCED_OPTIMIZATIONS

compiledFilename:

The file produced after running the dependencies and files through the compiler.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${project.build.finalName}-min.js

errorLevel:

Specifies how strict the compiler is at following the rules. The compiler is set to parameters matching SIMPLE by default, however, if you don't use WARNING or better, this isn't very useful. STRICT is set by default for this mojo. Possible values are:
  • SIMPLE
  • WARNING
  • STRICT

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Default: STRICT

frameworkTargetDirectory:

The file produced after running the dependencies and files through the compiler.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework

generateExports:

(no description)
  • Type: boolean
  • Required: No
  • Default: true

generatedDepsJS:

The file produced after running the dependencies and files through the compiler.
  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${project.build.finalName}-debug.js

inclusionStrategy:

What to include based off of maven includes. If you are creating an API with an empty src folder, or you expect to use all of the maven dependencies as source, set this to ALL. Possible values are:
  • ALL
  • WHEN_IN_SRCS

  • Type: java.lang.String
  • Required: No
  • Default: WHEN_IN_SRCS

sourceDirectory:

The default directory to extract files to. This likely shouldn't be changed unless there is a conflict with another plugin.
  • Type: java.io.File
  • Required: Yes
  • Default: ${project.build.directory}${file.separator}javascriptFramework${file.separator}output${file.separator}processedJavascript
